etymology.description: 西 (west) + 门/門 (gate) + 町 (ward/block) = West Gate Ward/District
etymology.interpretation: Refers to the commercial neighborhood that developed by the west gate of old Taipei. 町 preserves a Japanese-era administrative term for a town block (chō/machi).
etymology.simplification: Only 门 was simplified from 門; 町 is unchanged. In Taiwan it’s written in Traditional as 西門町, while Mainland usage writes 西门町.

parts.english: door; gate; entrance; classifier for subjects/branches
ward; town block; toponymic suffix (from Japanese); place-naming element

examples.chinese: 西门町(西門町)是台北市著名的商业娱乐区。
examples.pinyin: Xīmén Dīng shì Táiběi Shì zhùmíng de shāngyè yúlè qū.
examples.english: Ximending is a famous commercial and entertainment district in Taipei City.

examples.chinese: 我们周末去西门町(西門町)逛街看电影。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zhōumò qù Xīmén Dīng guàngjiē kàn diànyǐng.
examples.english: We’re going to Ximending on the weekend to shop and watch a movie.

examples.chinese: 西门町(西門町)的名称源自日治时期的町级行政区。
examples.pinyin: Xīmén Dīng de míngchēng yuánzì Rìzhì shíqí de dīng jí xíngzhèngqū.
examples.english: The name Ximending comes from the Japanese-era township-level administrative unit called ‘chō’ (町).
